DataElement.preferredName: Person Difficulty With Therapeutic Procedure Side Effect FACT-G Questionnaire Scale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score from the scale used by FACT-G Quality of Life questionnaire to assess a person's feelings of being bothered by treatment side effects. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Difficulty With Therapeutic Procedure Side Effect
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being._Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The term was used in various ways in the past, to describe unintended effects of medical intervention, usually negative (unfavourable), but also positive (favourable) ones. It is recommended that this term no longer be used and particularly should not be regarded as synonymous with adverse event or adverse reaction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

Concepts.definition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:An unwanted side effect of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

The term was used in various ways in the past, to describe unintended effects of medical intervention, usually negative (unfavourable), but also positive (favourable) ones. It is recommended that this term no longer be used and particularly should not be regarded as synonymous with adverse event or adverse reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated with permission from Dr. David Cella for use by CCR to collect FACT-G (v4.0) data in C3D.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from the 5-step scale used by FACT-G Quality of Life questionnaires to assess a patient. [Manually-curated]

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.:an ordered reference standard.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I am bothered by side effects
ReferenceDocuments.description: I am bothered by side effects of treatment.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated with permission from Dr. David Cella for use by CCR to capture FACT-G (v4.0) data in C3D.
